author: andschwa
body:
@paulcallen and I think it's worth the time for us to get this working (if possible), so the whole team can start using it. While we _can_ now attach `powershell.exe` (our Core PS build) to the VS debugger on Windows, that doesn't help if we're having to debug a Linux specific code path, and LLDB just doesn't cut it.

/cc @fearthecowboy did you make any headway with this, or have any tips?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I'm not confident those links will work; in my email they were prepended with `onenote:` in front of `https`, which GitHub (rightfully) didn't recognize as links.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: While remote debugging never worked, the new [Experimental .NET Core Debugging in VS Code](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/visualstudioalm/2016/03/10/experimental-net-core-debugging-in-vs-code/) has demonstrably allowed for single-stepping, so I'm closing this.

title: Enable remote .NET Core debugging
